item.title: First Problem: fd
item.description: fd TEST POST Upon clicking on the problem the hint reads: > Mommy! what is a file descriptor in Linux? A file descriptor is a unique number given to a file when it is opened using the open() call. It is the handle through which we can read or write files or any other input/output resource.
